remarks: Define the derangement function, which counts the number of bijections from a set to itself such that no element is mapped to itself. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 19-Jan-2015.)
statement:
derang.d $e |- D = ( x e. Fin |-> ( # ` { f | ( f : x -1-1-onto-> x /\ A. y e. x ( f ` y ) =/= y ) } ) ) $.
derangval $p |- ( A e. Fin -> ( D ` A ) = ( # ` { f | ( f : A -1-1-onto-> A /\ A. y e. A ( f ` y ) =/= y ) } ) ) $.
$d A f x y $.
$d f x y $.
$d f x y $.
$d f x y $.
$d f x y $.
$d f x y $.
$d f x y $.
$d x y $.
$d x y $.
$d x y $.
